CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provided that the procedure for enforcement of foreign judgments was determined by the relevant international treaties . It further stated that a judgment of a foreign court could be submitted for enforcement within DATE after its adoption .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that judgments of foreign courts concerning civil matters are recognized and enforced in GPE pursuant to a pertinent international treaty . It further stipulates that such judgments can be submitted for enforcement within DATE after their adoption .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that a request for enforcement of a foreign judgment should be filed with a regional court or other court of equal standing at the place of the debtor 's residence or location .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL sets out the rules of procedure applying to the requests for enforcement of foreign judgments .

CARDINAL . The court ruled that lack of a pertinent international treaty can not be cited as grounds for refusal of a request for enforcement of a foreign judgment . It further stated that such a request can be granted in the event that the courts of the relevant foreign ORG recognize the judgments of the NORP courts on the basis of reciprocity . It ordered that the lower court verify whether such reciprocity existed in the case at hand and inquire into the existence of other international treaties concerning the CARDINAL relevant GPE that might concern co - operation in the legal and judicial domain .
